messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba cleaning
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, Correct.  That s not to say that it s the only or even the most important factor in dating tsuba, or that an over cleaned guard couldn t be assigned to
messages.messageBody:
Milt,
Correct. That's not to say that it's the only or even the most important factor in dating tsuba, or that an over cleaned guard couldn't be assigned to the correct time period. But, it is a factor that can tip the judgment of the period one way or the other.

I'm with Milt on that Kanayama guard having been worked over a bit.

Jim



Jim,
Isn't it true that we are not supposed to clean the inside of the
sukashi as it may affect the proper dating of the jidai ?



milt



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: tsuba cleaning
messages.msgSnippet: I think there is a bit of light playing tricks here as well. Maybe you are right but on my 21 Sony it looks ok. I have a nice Choshu sukashi tsuba ( C: 1670 -
messages.messageBody:
I think there is a bit of light playing tricks here as well. Maybe you
are right but on my 21" Sony it looks ok. I have a nice Choshu sukashi
tsuba ( C: 1670 - 1700 ) that is also in excellent condition inside the
sukashi.

I see your point though.

Rich




>
>
> it's not the matter of the patina inside the sukashi, I am not saying
> it's been clean to a mirror shine but don't you think it's been cleaned
> out at all ? Imagine, Muromachi period and there's no dirt ? Must have
> been kept in a air-tight compartment then.
>
> Milt
>
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: tsuba cleaning
messages.msgSnippet: ... it s not the matter of the patina inside the sukashi, I am not saying it s been clean to a mirror shine but don t you think it s been cleaned out at all ?
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@w...>
wrote:
> nah, look at the lower pics, I think the patina is in tact, just in
> excellent condition
>
> Rich
>
>
>

it's not the matter of the patina inside the sukashi, I am not saying
it's been clean to a mirror shine but don't you think it's been cleaned
out at all ? Imagine, Muromachi period and there's no dirt ? Must have
been kept in a air-tight compartment then.

Milt
